channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside no10, 23rd February
item.description:
On the small green area the large is overhanging the houses and concern for falling branches and fungus on the tree. Resident is concerned and would the tree be inspected for safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Woodyard Close, Gospel Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 black bin with food waste by park gate / bin, 23rd February
item.description:
There are two black bin bags that appeared yesterday evening on the 22nd of January. This morning the bags are completely opened. I believe the foxes went at it. There is a lot of waste next to it, food, and various items. It looks petty unsafe as there are a lot of small children and dogs in this park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 84, East Dulwich Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin overflowing, 23rd February
item.description:
This recycling bin has been filled with general waste and is not being collected (understandably) by regular recycling collection. It is over flowing and blowing onto the road and pavement It has been here for three weeks It needs to be emptied into the general waste lorry (despite being in a recycling bin)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 149, Bexhill Road, Honor Oak, Greater London

item.title: 15 bin bags ripped open by pests, fly tip is now on pathway, 23rd February
item.description:
Hi, This issue has been reported so many times by residents and keeps getting marked as resolved when the mess is still there. There are now pests going through the bags , it is absolutely disgusting. The councillors for Belvedere are all aware of this issue and have been copied in on emails. We will keep emailing until this gets resolved. Please clean this up as it has been there for 7 weeks now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yarnton Way, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
